definition: to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: Was it okay for them to make love?
Men want to dream about sex with strangers.
sentences.chinese: 男人想夢見和陌生人做愛。

definition: to court/to go steady/to be dating
to live alone/to spend time alone (or with a significant other)
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
suffix, used to form interrogative 什麼|什么[shen2 me5], what?, indefinite 這麼|这么[zhe4 me5] thus, etc
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
faithful unto death (i.e. Confucian ban on widow remarrying)
